patterns: How can I pay my fees
How can I make the payment
How much does the course cost
responses: Each course has a different course structure based on the duration and the domain of study. For more information, please click the link

On-campus residence: $6,500 per year (8 months) including cable TV and high-speed internet access. Meals are not included. Off-campus housing: $400 - $800/month. For more information, please click the link

patterns: How much would it cost to live in Canada
responses: Most students budget approximately $20,000 to $24,000 annually to study and live in Windsor, Canada.

patterns: Is there Scholarships available for students
responses: Scholarships are available to full-time students who have a satisfactory academic standing (minimum GPA of 2.0 and higher) and for international students who have completed the Accuplacer Assessment. The General Scholarship application is available each year from October 1 until end of December. For more information, please click the link

patterns: Can I park my car inside college

The Social Insurance Number (SIN) is a 9-digit number issued in Canada to administer various government programs. A SIN is issued to one person only and it cannot legally be used by anyone else. For more information, please click the link

intents.tag: How to apply Social Insurance Number
patterns: Where to get Social Insurance Number

responses: You can apply SIN through online or by mail or in person.You can apply the SIN by clicking on the link

patterns: Where to you go for SIN
Where to get Social Insurance Number
Where should I go to get SIN
responses: Complete a service request form online and a Service Canada officer will call you back within two business days. For more information, please click the link

patterns: What should I have to get SIN
What should I carry to get SIN
responses: You must provide original documents; photocopies are not accepted. In order to determine which documents you must provide, please refer the link
If your request cannot be completed over the phone, you will be offered an appointment to visit a Service Canada Centre. For more information, please click the link

patterns: St. Clair college offer program related to public relations

Students will also learn how to shoot and edit professional photos, develop internal and external corporate communications plans, event plans, sponsorship plans. For more information please refer the link.

patterns: Are their Part time work opportunities available?
